data.title: Best Chinese Restaurant in Town with All You Can Eat Sushi and Mongolian BBQ
data.text: Buffett is large with ample space and can accommodate larger groups easily.  Food is fresh, hot and flavorful, price is reasonable but better at lunch.  There is a big selection of sushi, and it's all you care to eat; I haven't seen a deal like this anywhere.  On Sundays I have seen crab legs and steaks.  They also have a Mongolian BBQ where you pick the noodle, meats, or vegetables and have them stir fried on a grill in front of you.  The variety of sushi is outstanding and I think the taste is excellent.  The menu doesn't change much (although lunch and dinner are different), but with all the variety they offer, I don't see it as a problem. If you haven't tried it, it's definitely worth a shot.  If there's a Chinese buffet of this caliber within 100 miles, I sure don't know about it.

data.title: Good Chinese buffet
data.text: As far as cheap Chinese buffets go, this is a great one! It was $9 for lunch on a Saturday, they have the standard Chinese dishes, good sushi selection, and made to order grill. It's your standard Chinese buffet but I was quite pleased, no surprises good or bad!

data.title: Buffet in New Mexico
data.text:
Not much of buffet restaurants here in New
Mexico but for a
Chinese restaurant and others Grand Buffet is average. The sushi is good. Hope they can keep
all food warm without overcooking some
(Fish). 
Customer Service needs more training too. 😊

data.title: Meh.
data.text: It's a Chinese buffet what do you expect.  It's like cicis pizza vs pizza hut Chinese style.  We went there for lunch and found the selection as mediocre as the taste.

data.title: Unfriendly
data.text: We went for lunch today.  Good selection but it all taste the same.  Staff is very unfriendly.  Never saw a wait staff.  Would not go back.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: My family and I went to Grand Buffet to celebrate Chinese New Year a week ago. From the numerous choices of food...to the decorations...to the customer service...to the ambiance...our experience was utterly amazing. This was our second visit and we will definitely return again and again and highly recommend this wonderful restaurant for its absolutely delicious cuisine.

data.title: Not the best choice we have made
data.text: We didn't feel like driving and the Grand Buffet was located next to our hotel so we decided to try it.  Overall I was very disappointed.  I felt the price was very high for what we got.  There was a good variety but the food didn't have a lot of flavor and as someone else mentioned, it was not hot.

data.title: Nice Variety
data.text: I went in with low expectations, but came out pleasantly surprised. The service was mixed, though. The women working at the front were not very friendly, but the wait staff and sushi creator were very nice. There is a military discount, but we did not see this when we paid, and the women at the front made no  effort to fix it, so we just forgot about it. There was so much variety here! If you are unable to find at least 3 or 4 things you enjoy, I suggest you stay at home at cook :)

data.title: I plead temporary insanity.... what was I thinking?
data.text: In a couple of places, I have been surprised by a buffet that was decent, even, well... good; at the Broadmoor in Colorado Springs, CO and at Little America in Cheyenne, WY. But my son, who has been raised with me as a father will never even look at a buffet. For him, they represent the epitome of cow trough dining and food safety nightmares waiting to happen. So what was I expecting when I entered the Grand Buffet Hibachi and Sushi restaurant? I was lured by the thought of sushi; that social interactive eating event where the sushi chef playfully entertains with his knife cutting skills and creates before your eyes morsels of buttery textured fish, vinegar rice, and touches of wasabi when appropriate. Sushi is not meant to be laid out on a buffet with chilled air blasting over it until it is frost bitten and lifeless. Such is the case at Grand Buffet. True, the Grand Buffet offers a "wide selection" of almost anything that you can think of from frog legs to yakitori chicken, oysters on the half shells to sweet and sour chicken, mac and cheese, pizza, roast beef, stuffed mushrooms, egg rolls, fried rice.... you name it and they probably have it. It is a tribute to fast food and pile your plates so high that you forget that you are really being fed food that is devoid of the respect due the ingredients. In the end it all tastes the same.... it is "buffetisis" at an epidemic scale. And, because one does not know how long those oysters have been sitting there in the temperature danger zone.... I'd steer clear.

data.title: If you like cold food, this is your place!
data.text: Last time we were there the food offered on their buffet was mostly cold and tasteless. Nice selections of sushi though.

data.title: Great location, decent food and prices.
data.text: Plenty of food which was decent, the service wasn't the greatest though but the price of the food made up for it. The location is right next door to the hotel which is why we tried it. The food ran the gambit of seafood, the normal Asian food and roast beef and plenty of desserts.

data.title: BE CAUTIOUS .... Cleanliness and food temperatures
data.text:
Lets start with the totally unwelcoming person at the cash register. No smile. No greeting. Almost as if she is doing us a favor by being open.

Not sure if the odor in the place is just the food combination or the carpet, but there is a distinct FUNK in the air. Looks like the same layout and furniture from FURR'S.

I am concerned about food safety here. I brought with me a laser thermometer. Very few items were kept at the right temperature. The NM Department of Health says hot foods should be held at 140°F or warmer and cold foods should be held at 40°F or colder.

BE CAUTIOUS

Hardly anyone on the staff can communicate with patrons. Most know cursory English, but most just nod and say 'Thank you'.

This place is not good and is not a good representation of Chinese food. Many items look like they have been there for hours and most things look strikingly similar (meaning not attractive). Our party sampled a wide variety of food this day and to be honest, not many people enjoyed it. Let's just leave it as average to poor. 

Now, if you really have to eat here, I would recommend their version of Mongolian BBQ. You pick the proteins and vegetables, but you pick from a limited selection of hot sauce or teriyaki. At least you know the ingredients and it will be served HOT.

I really did not enjoy my visit to the Grand Buffet. It is EXACTLY the same items from the old place and they need to upgrade the food.

data.title: Very Disappointed
data.text: My husband love Chinese/Asian food.  So we decided to try the Grand Buffet.  After hearing radio ads and seeing billboards we thought we would give it a try.  The actual set up of the buffet was nice but not all the dishes were labeled.   It was difficult to tell what was what.  There was no one at the buffet giving instructions as to how Hibachi worked either.   Most of the food we had other then the spicey products had a flat flavor to them.  The staff were not very friendly or accomodating as at other Chinese Buffets we have been to.  The tables were ok sticky... Carpets look like they have not been cleaned in months.   Came in for early dinner and had to go somewhere else for dessert after going to get some from fruit from the buffet only to find it moldy (strawberries)... I travel to Las Cruces often but will not eat here again nor recommend it to any one I know.

data.title: Quantity over quality
data.text: I saw some ads and tried it.  Lots of stuff, but most over cooked and dried out.  Sushi was good as were the egg rolls but most of the chicken selections were like leather, just cooked too long or too long on the hearing tables.  Mostly Chinese style food with jello and puddings for dessert.

data.title: Large buffet of Chinese food, plus sushi
data.text: This place recently opened, in the building that used to house Furr's. They have put in new black tables, but otherwise don't seem to have renovated much. The restrooms are the same as before, except the women's restroom now has all sorts of Disney-type stickers on the stalls--it looks "busy". My husband referred to the men's restroom as "grungy". He also said the dining room floor was dirty. There was a great variety of food--soups, salads, Chinese dishes, fruits, some desserts, and the sushi. I had some cold shrimp and crab legs, as well as salads and hot food. I don't recommend the seaweed salad--too salty and a bit odd tasting. I thought the food was good, but even at the senior price ($10.35 each), it was a bit pricey. Next to the sushi table, there was an ice cream freezer that was not plugged in. Altogether it had a somewhat unfinished look.

data.title: Riesiges Buffett zum Schleuderpreis
data.text: Was da für ca. $ 13 pro Person geboten wird, ist unglaublich: Sushi, Crablegs, Austern, Roastbeef und hunderte anderer Gerichte à discretion. Kein Gourmet- Restaurant, aber gutes und währschaftes Essen !
